title: Feature Request: add support for `.whl` file extension in `download_and_extract` function in `repository_ctx`
body:
### Description of the feature request:


A wheel file is a ZIP file with the `.whl` extension, as per https://peps.python.org/pep-0427/#abstract.

I would like [repository_ctx.download_and_extract](https://bazel.build/rules/lib/builtins/repository_ctx#download_and_extract) to support the `.whl` file extension as a valid extension.

It's similar to https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/17824, closed by https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/17825.

### Which category does this issue belong to?

Core

### What underlying problem are you trying to solve with this feature?


I marked it as `Core`, but I'm not entirely sure which category it would fall into.

This is an attempt to retrieve artifacts from `.whl` files. The immediate use case is to retrieve `uv` from a `wheel` like [uv-0.7.13-py3-none-macosx_11_0_arm64.whl](https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/46/c7/1d7ec2211732512ae43d7176242fea3eea1915c83565953014bbafcb6be2/uv-0.7.13-py3-none-macosx_11_0_arm64.whl). 

With this implemented, I could get [rules_multitool](https://github.com/theoremlp/rules_multitool) to work without changing the rule set.

This also enables other use cases and would be particularly useful for air-gapped environments, which may have private PyPI repositories with these artifacts available to be used as toolchains, but currently can't or would have to implement a solution for it.

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


MacOS

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 8.2.1
